summary: An Ordinance of the City of Seattle, amending Section Three of Ordinance No. 24547, entitled "An Ordinance of the City of Seattle granting to the Northern Pacific Railway Company a corporation, organized under the laws of the State of Wisconsin, its successors and assigns, in perpetuity, the right, privilege and authority to locate, law down, construct, maintain and operate sundry railway tracks in, along, upon and across sundry streets, avenues, alleys and other public places, and upon other property, all within the limits of said city, and granting to said company, its successors and assigns, rights of way for such tracks in, along, upon and across such streets, avenues, alleys and other public places and property of and in said city," approved July 11, 1910, as amendec.
